abstract: American Society of Clinical Oncology releases so-called value framework to help doctors and patients assess different cancer treatments according to rubric that includes cost as well as efficacy and possibility of side effects; release is part of shift among doctors to address rapid increases in prices of cancer drugs, and value framework takes into account out-of-pocket costs paid by patients and costs to health system.
lead_paragraph: Alarmed by soaring prices for cancer drugs, the leading American oncology society has devised a “value framework” to evaluate treatments by effectiveness, side effects and cost.

headline.main: Cancer Doctors Offer Way to Compare Medicines, Including by Cost
headline.print_headline: Evaluating Cancer Drugs on Cost, Too
